turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about New England/Acadian forests.
turn.1: What types of birds are found in the New England/Acadian forests?
turn.2: The forests are habitat for wild turkey ("Meleagris gallopavo"), mallard duck ("Anas platyrhynchos"), wood duck ("Aix sponsa"), great horned owl ("Bubo virginianus"), and a great number of passerine birds.
turn.4: The area is particularly important as a feeding ground for birds migrating on the Atlantic Flyway.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The peatland of western Massachusetts are home to bog turtles ("Glyptemys muhlenbergii").
turn.8: Former species of fauna that roamed this region were the gray wolf, the eastern cougar, and the eastern elk, all three of which were wiped out from the region after the arrival of European settlers.
turn.9: What types of plants are found in the Acadian forests?
turn.10: This forest has been radically altered over centuries by clearance for agriculture, mining and urban development including Halifax, Nova Scotia and summer homes in Quebec.
turn.11: Is it still a wild habitat?
turn.12: Today only about 5% of the forest remains in its natural state.
